body: Hmn.. then please rebase.
@btallman Did you test your fix against my attached code? Because, it still doesn't work against my provided example. I am resetting the DB before running by the way.
OK, this is passing CI now. Ready for you to look at it @r39132.
voting for this PR! IMHO it will make Airflow behave more like enterprise workflow management tools
+1 Welcome @caique-lima and @WesleyBatista ...
FYI.. we also need the JIRA prefixed in the commit message.. have a look at the Airflow contributor guide. I'll take care of it on merge this time.
I like what this PR is doing, and look forward to being able to use it with our Postgres backend.
caveat tests and rebase, +1
caveat a few minor nit-picks, +1

Is it our job to set other people's dependencies?

The piece that I worry about is someone else setting a requirements file with airflow and some other things and having issues controlling the specific versions of libraries used.

As a library, it should be our job to specify the minimum that we need and let our users specify the exact versions they care about.

Landscape and Travis both giving false alerts.. Landscape showing 6 warnings fixed, though they are not part of my diff. Travis run on my repo got succeeded https://travis-ci.org/msumit/airflow/builds/167346507..

Hi @sekikn I took responsibility of successful closure of this PR, and to be able to do so I would like to give my comments:
1. As others suggested, Instead of having a separate page, we should accommodate this in the existing page only, ideally as a tabbed view. 
2. Please add a basic test case at `core.py#test_dag_views`.
3. Modify the commit message so the title should not exceed than 50 chars.

We've 1 weeks time before this PR gets the label of  `Abandoned` and closed without being merged.

Hi @dm-tran, I see there is no activity on this PR. If you still wants to pursue this PR, then please resolve the conflicts and modify the commit message such that subject line should not exceed 50 chars. 

We've 1 weeks time before marking this PR `Abandoned` and finally closing without merging.

Hi @withnale.. sorry for long delay in reviewing this PR. If you still wants to pursue this PR, please resolve the conflict and address the concern raised by @mistercrunch. You would also need to change the commit message, so that it doesn't cross the 50 char limit. 

We've 1 weeks time before this PR gets marked as `Abandoned` and gets closed without being merged to master.

Hi @Vic020.. Sorry for delay in reviewing this PR. If you still wants to pursue this PR, you've to do following things:
1. Create a JIRA under Apache Airflow project (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW/)
2. Rebase you branch with master and squash all commits into a single commit
3. Commit message should follow the [guidelines](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/Contributors%27+Guide), especially the last section. 
4. Add some basic specs and make sure travis stays green. 

We've 1 weeks time before this PR gets marked as `Abandoned` and finally gets closed without being merged to master.

Hi @sdiazb .. Sorry for delay in reviewing this PR. If you still wants to pursue this PR, you've to do following things:
1. Create a JIRA under Apache Airflow project (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW/)
2. Rebase you branch with master and squash all commits into a single commit
3. Commit message should follow the [guidelines](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/Contributors%27+Guide), especially the last section.
4. Add some basic specs and make sure travis stays green.

Apart from this IMO we should not change the default behaviour, so the flag should be to `skip` examples and not to add examples. 

We've 1 weeks time before this PR gets marked as Abandoned and finally gets closed without being merged to master.

Hi @zstan .. Sorry for delay in reviewing this PR. If you still wants to pursue this PR, you've to do following things:
1. Rebase you branch with master and resolve conflicts
2. Commit message should follow the guidelines, i.e. should include `[AIRFLOW-xxx]`
3. Add some basic specs and make sure travis stays green.

We've 1 weeks time before this PR gets marked as Abandoned and finally gets closed without being merged to master.

4. Add some basic specs and make sure travis stays green.

We've 1 weeks time before this PR gets marked as Abandoned and finally gets closed without being merged to master.

2. Rebase you branch with master and squash all commits into a single commit
3. Commit message should follow the guidelines, especially the last section.

We've 1 weeks time before this PR gets marked as Abandoned and finally gets closed without being merged to master.

Hi @mistercrunch .. Sorry for delay in reviewing this PR. If you still wants to pursue this PR, you've to do following things:
1. Create a JIRA under Apache Airflow project (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW/)
2. Rebase you branch with master, resolve all conflicts and squash them in a single commit
3. Commit message should follow the guidelines, especially the last section.
4. Add some basic specs and make sure travis stays green.

We've 1 weeks time before this PR gets marked as Abandoned and finally gets closed without being merged to master.
@msumit @zstan as this one had stalled, it was already fixed by another PR. Please close it.

@mistercrunch Pretty sure we can close this no?

@adambom Sorry I dropped the ball on this. I think appending the task properties at the end should be enough since in Java, the later option supersedes the earlier one. Let me know if you are still willing to work on it, or I could probably get it across the finish line if you prefer.
@SivaPandeti This has been fixed in master. We should consider closing this.
@plypaul, do you want to rebase and we can merge this?

@yuanfeiz Sorry it took us time to get to this. Overall, I think the idea is worthwhile, but I am not sure about the implementation. The hook looks fine, but I am worried about the sensor returning data. I do not think we have a good story for queue triggered DAGs just yet, but if you still want to go forward, happy to work with you on a design that makes sense.
@yuanfeiz Also, we are trying to clean up open PRs, so if I do not hear from you, I will close the PR.

@lucafuji I am not sure we have a clear design for this on our end, but if you still want to be involved feel free to reply. If we do not hear from you, we might close this PR for now as part of a cleanup effort for long standing PRs.

@lucafuji, aside from the nits, this still looks useful. If you want to still contribute, you could rebase and we could check it against current tests. A unit test would be welcome. If we do not hear in 5 days, I will probably close as abandoned.

@yuanfeiz, as an effort to clean up old PRs I am taking a closer look. I am not sure how I feel about the added code to get the executor in lower case. I think it is fine to test against the CamelCase version since it is what we expect. if you really feel like it, you can test against `executor_type.lower()` whenever you need. Let me know if you want to rebase and continue with this PR. If we do not hear in a few days, we will close this as abandoned.

@tonylee0329 Sorry it took us a while to get back to you. I get this could be covered by having a runtime check on the python version, and a function that either decode(utf-8) if it is python 2 or just returns the already unicode string in Python 3. Let me know if you feel OK rebasing, if I do not hear from you I will close this PR.

@aminghadersohi This still looks useful, are you still interested in contributing further? If you can rebase, we can try to see if this could be merged. We are cleaning old PRs, and if I do not hear from you by the end of the week, I will just close this.
@Jparks2532 Can you close this since it has been merged to master?

@lauralorenz This looks good to me, sorry it took us a long time to get to this. I created a JIRA issue for this. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-575 If you can just have your PR reference this, I will merge it into master.
@mistercrunch Do you want to close this?
The change LGTM. @jbrownlucid, if you can create a JIRA issue, we can get this across the "merge" line.
@wxiang7 Do you want to address the comments? We are trying to close old PRs, so happy to work with you if you want to rebase/address the comments, otherwise we will close the PR.

Hi @msumit , anyway, thanks for your reply.

i will follow the step you given one by one.

Woo first real `git rebase` experience. I rebased with upstream master and amended my commit message to include the JIRA reference. Same with the PR title. I think this is good now, let me know if it needs anything else. @artwr
@lauralorenz Thank you! This has been merged to master.
Cool, do I need to do anything to the JIRA issue too?
Just marked it as resolved. Thanks again.
@artwr Sure, I will rebase from master and submit another diff soon

@artwr Feel free to abandon this one, this PR also has race condition issue though.
Looking forward to your new design

@artwr 
I accidentally closed the old pull request
https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/1122
, just create this one to substitute it

@mistercrunch please rebase, create a referring Jira, squash commits, prefix commit and PR titles with JIRA issue id, and let me know once done. If no changes occur in the next 5 days, I will close for inactivity! If you intend to work on this in the next 2 weeks, I can keep it open.

@mistercrunch please rebase, create a referring Jira, squash commits, prefix commit and PR titles with JIRA issue id, and let me know once done. If no changes occur in the next 5 days, I will close for inactivity! If you intend to work on this in the next 2 weeks, I can keep it open.

@mistercrunch please rebase, create a referring Jira, squash commits, prefix commit and PR titles with JIRA issue id, and let me know once done. If no changes occur in the next 5 days, I will close for inactivity! If you intend to work on this in the next 2 weeks, I can keep it open.

@mistercrunch please rebase, create a referring Jira, squash commits, prefix commit and PR titles with JIRA issue id, and let me know once done. If no changes occur in the next 5 days, I will close for inactivity! If you intend to work on this in the next 2 weeks, I can keep it open.

@mistercrunch please rebase, create a referring Jira, squash commits, prefix commit and PR titles with JIRA issue id, and let me know once done. Also, please address the comments here. If no changes occur in the next 5 days, I will close for inactivity! If you intend to work on this in the next 2 weeks, I can keep it open.
@mistercrunch let me know what you would like to do with this. This is an important change that I would like to see committed, so please prioritize it, else we will need to close.
@r39132 I guess `delete` is good to have.. in case someone wants to do a cleanup of a bad run?
Feel free to close, we have work around internally.

Hi @msumit, I have resolved the conflicts and modified the commit message.

The code quality check from landscape has failed, but details cannot be seen at the moment : https://landscape.io/github/apache/incubator-airflow/pulls/1517 displays "Server Error (500)"

Hi @artwr, really glad to see updates on this thread. Basically we had been using it as a background job coordinator and executors with DAG. 

Sorry it has been a while I haven't kept up with the community, so I might be lack of the recent development. Is it the use case Airflow intends to cover? Let me know if there is anything I can help.
Sure, it looks stale. Go ahead closing it.
@r39132 Sorry that I've missed your comment. May I rebase this PR and submit as another one?
@msumit thanks for your comment! I'll address that by the time this PR is closed.

@mmmaia I'm not quite sure I understand what you mean - the only role-based credentials I see in the S3_Hook.py are used for STS, which requires the key-based credentials. Would you mind clarifying on next steps?

Closing. Would prefer to solve this using kwargs as discussed in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRFLOW-559

Another of my PR failing due to continuous-integration/travis-ci/pr failed. Just wondering whether whether a clean build will pass the checks
BTW, while it says fail here, all 6 are succeeding on my fork, although I did have to kick one to run again...

@wmorin Check out https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AIRFLOW/Contributors%27+Guide

Essentially, squash your commits. Also, please list BlaBlaCar in alphabetic order. Finally, you should create a JIRA to point to this commit and prefix your commit with AIRFLOW-XXX, but if you don't get to that, it doesn't matter. I can do so also when I merge the change.
5 out of 6 is good enough:-)
Thanks for your help @r39132. I have made the changes. Please, let me know if I need to do something else.
Thx @wmorin Welcome to the community!

@aoen, put in the changes you pointed out. Please take a look.
LGTM! Just want to verify that this was tested on a running scheduler before I merge.

@aoen, yes I tested it on a running scheduler, including the conditions that we talked about:
- symlink absent
- symlink present, and updates when the log directory changes (on date change)
- skips with a warning when a file / directory is already present with that name.
Awesome! Big thanks for doing this.
